sep.gaia.util

Class IntegerBoundingBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.util.IntegerBoundingBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoundingBox

    public class IntegerBoundingBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements BoundingBox
    Class to represent the size of a rectangle by giving the coordinates of the upper left corner and the lower right corner. All used 3d vectors are used for 2-dimensional coordinates and have 0 as their z-coordinate. The coordinates are represented as integer values.
    Author:
    Max Witzelsperger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntegerBoundingBox(IntegerVector3D upLeft, IntegerVector3D lowRight)
      Generates a new bounding box with int coordinates.

      IntegerVector3D getUpperRight()
      Gets the upper right coordinate.
      void setLowerRight(Vector3D lowerRight)
      Sets the lower right coordinate if the argument lowerRight together with the current upper left coordinate upperLeft of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight.
      void setUpperLeft(Vector3D upperLeft)
      Sets the upper left coordinate if the argument upperLeft together with the current lower right coordinate lowerRight of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntegerBoundingBox

        public IntegerBoundingBox(IntegerVector3D upLeft,
                  IntegerVector3D lowRight)
                   throws NotABoxException
        Generates a new bounding box with int coordinates. The z-coordinates of all used vectors will be ignored and should be 0. The given coordinates must form a valid rectangle, which is the case if and only if upLeft.getX() < lowRight.getX() and upLeft.getY() > lowRight.getY() are both true. Otherwise those two values will initially be null.
        Parameters:
        upLeft - the coordinates of the upper left corner in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate may be set as required.
        lowRight - the coordinates of the lower right corner in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate may be set as required.
        Throws:
        NotABoxException - Thrown if the passed corners do not form a rectangle.

    • Method Detail

      • getUpperLeft

        public IntegerVector3D getUpperLeft()
        Description copied from interface: BoundingBox
        Gets the upper left coordinate of this.
        Specified by:
        getUpperLeft in interface BoundingBox
        Returns:
        the upper left coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is 0

      • setUpperLeft

        public void setUpperLeft(Vector3D upperLeft)
        Sets the upper left coordinate if the argument upperLeft together with the current lower right coordinate lowerRight of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight. Otherwise the invocation of this method is without effect. Additionally the parameter upperLeft must be an instance of IntegerVector3D, otherwise the new value will not be set.
        Specified by:
        setUpperLeft in interface BoundingBox
        Parameters:
        upperLeft - the new coordinates for the upper left corner of this, which must be an instance of IntegerVector3D and of which the z-coordinate is assumed to be 0 and will otherwise be ignored

      • getLowerRight

        public IntegerVector3D getLowerRight()
        Description copied from interface: BoundingBox
        Gets the lower right coordinate.
        Specified by:

      • setLowerRight

        public void setLowerRight(Vector3D lowerRight)
        Sets the lower right coordinate if the argument lowerRight together with the current upper left coordinate upperLeft of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight. Otherwise the invocation of this method is without effect. Additionally the parameter lowerRight must be an instance of IntegerVector3D, otherwise the new value will not be set.
        Specified by:
        setLowerRight in interface BoundingBox
        Parameters:
        lowerRight - the new coordinates for the lower right corner of this, which must be an instance of IntegerVector3D and of which the z-coordinate is assumed to be 0 and will otherwise be ignored
